articles.author: Amina Ismail
articles.description: The mass evictions of Alawites from privately owned homes have not been previously reported.
articles.title: Minutes to leave: Syria's Alawites evicted from private homes at gunpoint

articles.author: Vitalii Hnidyi
articles.description: Swarms of Russian drones attacked the Ukrainian cities of Kharkiv and Dnipro, killing at least one person and wounding around 50, officials said.
articles.title: Russian drone attacks kill at least one person in Ukraine

articles.author: Minh Nguyen, Francesco Guarascio
articles.description: Vietnam is celebrating the end of the Vietnam War on Wednesday with a grand military parade and an air show 50 years after the fall of Saigon, the event that marked the definitive conclusion of the decades-long conflict.
articles.title: Celebrations in Ho Chi Minh City to mark 50 years since the end of the Vietnam War

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin is open to peace in Ukraine and intense work is going on with the United States, but the conflict is so complicated that the rapid progress that Washington wants is difficult to achieve, the Kremlin said.
articles.title: Kremlin says Putin is open to Ukraine peace but warns against rushing a deal

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Gram Slattery, David Morgan
articles.description: Trump renewed his criticisms of Fed Chair Powell and doubled down on calls for Congress to slash taxes, a plan that budget analysts said could add trillions to the nation's $36.6 trillion in debt.
articles.title: Trump touts economy at Michigan 100-day rally, as Americans grow wary

articles.author: David Lawder, Andrea Shalal, Kalea Hall
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump signed an order to soften the blow of his auto tariffs on Tuesday with a mix of credits and relief from other levies on materials, and his trade team touted its first deal with a foreign trading partner, developments that eased investor worries about Trump's erratic trade policies.
articles.title: Trump eases auto tariffs burden as Lutnick touts one done foreign trade deal

articles.author: Giulia Segreti, Elvira Pollina
articles.description: With betting on the next pope frowned upon in the home of the Vatican, thousands of Italians have instead taken to playing "Fantapapa", an online game inspired by the fantasy leagues familiar to sports fans.
articles.title: Italians play 'Fantapapa' while others bet on identity of new pope

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China has decided to lift sanctions on four current and one former member of the European Parliament as well as on its subcommittee on human rights, a parliament official told Reuters.
articles.title: China to lift sanctions on EU Parliament members, official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's SBU security agency was responsible for a drone strike on a defence manufacturing facility in Russia, an SBU official told Reuters on Wednesday.
articles.title: Ukraine struck Russian weapons factory, SBU security agency source says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia and North Korea on Wednesday began construction of a road bridge between the two countries that will span the Tumen river, part of an effort to strengthen their strategic partnership, Russia's prime minister said.
articles.title: Russia begins building road bridge to North Korea, PM says
